nodes.bodyText:
Ideally the memory limits should be set when the QueryContext is created. Fundamentally it is never created when the session is not available. Setting it here is confusing, and potentially error prone, as the memory limits could be lost in a hypothetical situation when updateTask is never called.
It feels like the entire SqlTaskManager has to be refactored. The TaskContext / QueryContext should be aware of the session at the moment of creation.
Additionaly the ResourceOvercommit feature should probably be removed (CC: @nezihyigitbasi ?)

Yeah I noticed that pain point. It took a while to arrive at updateTask and see that I was not the first person to have this issue.
I didn't want to change it because I assumed the design is such that it can be retrieved before updateTask is called for a reason. All you need is a taskId.

wrap new QueryManagerConfig().
We prefer either one of the style
doSomethign(parameter1, parameter2)

or
doSomethign(
  parameter1, 
  parameter2)

We are trying to avoid the
doSomethign(parameter1, 
  parameter2)

style across the codebase
